level.heading: Organization certificate; execution; contents.
level.text: The persons referred to in § 26-1301 shall, under their hands and seals, execute before some officer in said District competent to take the acknowledgment of deeds, an organization certificate, which shall specifically state:
The purposes for which it is formed;
The term for which it is to exist, which shall not exceed the term of 50 years, and be subject to alteration, amendment, or repeal by Congress at any time;
The number of its directors and the names and residences of the officers who for the first year are to manage the affairs of the company; and
The amount of its capital stock and its subdivision into shares.

level.text: For legislative history of D.C. Law 11-255, see Historical and Statutory Notes following § 26-1301.
